intro: Turnera hilaireana var. minor, commonly known as the Hilaire's turnera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture, while its flowers are usually white or pale yellow with prominent stamens. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
